content.title: Marriage Assistance For Legally Married Transgender Couples
content.department: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
content.beneficiary: Legally married transgender couples who have undergone Sex Reassignment Surgery (SRS)
content.details: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance for Legally Married Transgender Couples' was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. The Government of Kerala has introduced this scheme which provides marriage assistance for legally married transgender couples who have undergone Sex Reassignment Surgery (SRS). The amount of marriage assistance has been fixed to ₹30,000/-. This scheme is intended to help deprived transgender individuals who are planning to get married legally to lead a steady normal family life.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹30,000/- will be provided to legally married transgender couples who have undergone Sex Reassignment Surgery (SRS).
eligibility: The applicants must possess a Transgender Identity card.
The applicant should be a resident of Kerala.
Transgender couples must apply for financial assistance after 6 months from the date of marriage and not exceeding the 1-year period.
For receiving the aid, one of the partners should belong to the Transgender community.
Those who have already availed of the financial assistance but opted for second marriage after divorce won’t be eligible for further aid.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.
documents_required: Identity card i.e. Aadhaar Card, Election ID/ Voter ID
Self-declaration Affidavit stating that the applicant is Transgender
Bank details- Copy of Pass Book
Copy of marriage certificate/Marriage Registration Certificate (issued as per Panchayat/Municipality, Corporation/Special Marriage Act)
Original certificate (from Ward member/Councillor) proving that the married couple is living together.
Affidavit of Public Representative that the couple has been living together for the last 6 months or more.

faqs.question: What is the 'Marriage Assistance For Legally Married Transgender Couples' scheme?
faqs.answer: The government of Kerala has introduced this scheme which provides marriage assistance for legally married transgender couples who have undergone Sex Reassignment Surgery (SRS). The amount of marriage assistance has been fixed to ₹30,000/-. This scheme is intended to help deprived transgender individuals who are planning to get married legally to lead a steady normal family life.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The legally married transgender couples who have undergone Sex Reassignment Surgery (SRS) are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for transgender?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for transgender.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹30,000/- will be provided to legally married transgender couples who have undergone Sex Reassignment Surgery (SRS).

faqs.question: Does the Transgender ID card mandatory for the applicant?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicants must possess a Transgender Identity card.

faqs.question: Does the transgender community eligible for financial assistance in case of second marriage?
faqs.answer: No, the transgender who has already availed of the financial assistance but opted for second marriage after divorce won’t be eligible for further aid.

faqs.question: Should both the partners belong to the Transgender community receiving the marriage aid?
faqs.answer: No, for receiving the aid, one of the partners should belong to the Transgender community.

faqs.question: Within how many days of marriage should Transgender couples apply for financial assistance?
faqs.answer: Transgender couples must apply for financial assistance after 6 months from the date of marriage and not exceeding the 1-year period.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant should visit the Official Portal- SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.
